diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma.
specimens.gross_description: Specimen #1 is received in formalin in a container labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, "uterus" per the requisition and consists of an aggregate of tan white-pink irregularly-shaped tissue fragments (2.6 x 1.8 x 1.0 cm). specimens.microscopic_description: The sections show three fragments of atypical squamous epithelium that are admixed with abundant acute neutrophilic exudate and superficial squamous debris. The intact fragments consist of proliferation of markedly atypical squamous non-keratinizing squamous epithelium. The nuclei are large with abundant cytoplasm. Atypical mitotic figures are frequently present. In one fragment there is underlying stroma present and irregular fingers of atypical neoplastic squamous epithelium is seen extending into the stroma.
comments: Dr. Shenoy has reviewed the slides and concurs

specimens.microscopic_description: The overall morphological findings show features consistent with cautery and reactive changes in block A2. The focus of cautery artifact is difficult to evaluate morphologically, so immunohistochemical stains (IHC; single antibody procedures with adequate controls) for Ki-67 and p16 were performed; the immunostain for p16 shows no block-like staining, and for Ki-67 shows no increase in mitotic activity (with mitoses largely confined to the basal layer of the squamous epithelium), confirming the morphological impression.

specimens.source_procedure: UTERUS, UTERUS AND TUBES, SUPRACERVICAL HYSTERECTOMY WITH BILATERAL SALPINGECTOMY
diagnosis: Uterus with exaggerated placental site
Endometrium with decidual changes
Unremarkable serosa
Bilateral unremarkable fallopian tubes
specimens.gross_description: Specimen #1 is received in formalin labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, "uterus and tubes" and consists of a supracervical tan-pink uterine fundus (8.6 x 7.2 x 4.5 cm, 232 grams) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (right: 9.7 x 0.8 x 0.8 cm, left: 9.9 x 0.8 x 0.6 cm). The uterine fundus serosal surface is tan-pink and smooth. The cervical canal resection margin is markedly dilated (3.4 cm in diameter) with adhered clotted blood. The cervical resection margin is inked blue and the uterine fundus is bivalved to reveal an endometrial cavity (6.5 x 4.0 cm) with a marked amount of adhered clotted blood and red-brown soft tissue ranging from 0.2 to 0.7 cm thick. Both halves are serially sectioned to reveal a myometrium ranging from 1.5 to 2.0 cm with tightly adhered clotted blood and probable decidua. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan lumen. Section code: 1A: Anterior ectocervical canal resection margin 1B - 1D: Anterior endomyometrium 1E: Posterior ectocervical canal resection margin 1F - 1H: Posterior endomyometrium 1I: Right fallopian tube, representative 1J: Left fallopian tube, representative
specimens.microscopic_description: The sections of uterus show endometrium with progestational changes. In on area the walll of the uterus is infiltrated by intermediate trophoblasts and multinucleated trophoblasts. The trophoblasts infiltrate between bundles of smooth muscle in cords, nest and individual cells up to 7 mm in depth. The trophoblast react strongly to cytokeratin and weakly to HCG.
comments: Exaggerated placental sites have been associated with emergency hysterectomies and abortions.

specimens.source_procedure: Uterus, cervix, and fallopian tubes, hysterectomy with bilateral salpingectomy
diagnosis: Cervix with nabothian cysts
Proliferative endometrium
Uterine leiomyoma with bizarre nuclei
Adenomyosis
Unremarkable salpinges
specimens.gross_description: A. Uterus. Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, 'uterus, cervix, bilateral fallopian tubes' and consists of a distorted tan-brown uterus (14.5 x 13.1 x 5.6 cm, 653 g) with attached right unfimbriated fallopian tube segment (4.1 x 0.5 x 0.4 cm) with evidence of tubal ligation. Additionally, and separately in the container is a tan-pink fimbriated fallopian tube (3.9 x 0.5 x 0.5 cm). The uterine fundus serosal surface is tan, smooth, markedly distorted, and disrupted in the anterior aspect. There are marked adhesions identified at the anterior and posterior aspects of the uterus. The ectocervix (3.4 x 3.3 cm) is tan-pink and slightly ragged. The specimen is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal (3.9 cm in length) which is slightly hemorrhagic with herringbone architecture. The endometrial cavity (4.2 x 1.2 x 0.2 cm) is hemorrhagic and markedly distorted by a tan-white whorled nodule (5.6 x 4.9 x 4.0 cm) present at the fundus in the anterior aspect within tan-pink slightly trabeculated myometrium ranging from 2.2-3.2 cm in thickness. There is a transmural rupture (5.2 x 3.6 x 2.8 cm) identified at the anterior aspect of the uterus exposing the tan-white whorled nodule. Both anterior and posterior halves are serially sectioned to reveal the tan-white whorled nodule with white homogenous cut surfaces. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan dilated lumens. Section code A 1: Anterior ectocervix with endocervical canal, representative A 2: Posterior ectocervix with endocervical canal, representative A 3- A 4: Anterior endomyometrium, representative A 5-A 6: Posterior endomyometrium, representative A 7-A 9: Tan-white whorled nodule, representative A 10-A 11: Serosal adhesions, representative A 12: Right fallopian tube, representative A 13: Left fallopian tube, representative A14-A19: Tan-white whorled nodule, additional representative sections

specimens.source_procedure: UTERUS, CERVIX, FALLOPIAN TUBES, AND OVARIES, TOTAL HYSTERECTOMY WITH BILATERAL SALPINGO-OOPHORECTOMY
diagnosis: High grade dysplasia involving ectocervix/vagina.
Excision margins negative for dysplasia.
Cervix with stenotic external os.
Atrophic endometrium.
Uterine leiomyomas with degenerative changes.
Unremarkable salpinges, bilateral.
Unremarkable ovary, right.
Rete cyst, left ovary.
specimens.gross_description: A. Uterus. Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with patient's name, medical record number,' uterus, cervix, bilateral fallopian tubes, bilateral ovaries, upper vagina" and consists of a tan-pink uterus (5.4 x 9.2 x 2.1 cm, 190 g) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (left: 4.8 x 0.8 x 0.3 cm, right: 5.3 x 0.7 x 0.3 cm), and attached bilateral ovaries (left: 3.2 x 2.2 x 0.6 cm, right: 2.5 x 2.0 x 0.4 cm). There is an intact fluid filled cyst (2.0 x 1. 5 cm) present on the left ovary. The uterine fundus serosal surface is irregular, hard, and nodular. The ectocervix is not patent and is covered by fold of vaginal mucosa (4.0 x 3.5 cm). The specimen is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal 2.1 cm in length. The endocervical canal stroma is tan- white. The endometrial cavity is 2.5 x 2.2 and is lined by tan- white 0.3 cm thick endometrium. The myometrium thickness is 1.1-2.5 cm. Multiple tan- pink to tan- white whorled, and calcified subserosal and intramural nodules ranging from 0.8 to 3.3 cm are identified. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan- brown tissue with lumens. The bilateral ovaries are serially sectioned to reveal tan-white, variegated cut surfaces with identifiable corpora albicans. On sectioning the left ovary with fluid filled cyst, clear fluid is released and thickness of the cyst is 0.2 cm. Ink code: Blue: Anterior vaginal fold; Black: Posterior vaginal fold Section code: A1-A2: Cervix, bisected, 12 to 3 quadrant, submitted entirely, on edge A3-A5: Cervix, bisected, 3 to 6 quadrant, submitted entirely, on edge A6-A11: Cervix, bisected, 6 to 9 quadrant. submitted entirely, on edge A12-A15: Cervix, bisected, 9 to 12 quadrant, submitted entirely, on edge A16: Anterior endomyometrium, representative A17: Posterior endomyometrium with nodule, representative A18-A19: Nodule in relation to endomyometrium, representative A20-A21: Right adnexa, representative A22-A23: Left adnexa, representative
comments: Immunostain with appropriate control for p16 performed on 2 separate blocks is positive. The ectocervix shows scarring and it is difficult to determine whether the dysplasia involves the ectocervix or proximal vagina.

specimens.source_procedure: UTERUS, CERVIX, FALLOPIAN TUBES AND OVARIES, HYSTERECTOMY WITH BILATERAL SALPINGO-OOPHORECTOMY
diagnosis: Unremarkable cervix
Secretory endometrium
Unremarkable myometrium
Unremarkable salpinges and ovaries, bilateral
specimens.gross_description: A. Uterus. Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with patient's name, medical record number, "uterus, tubes, ovaries, and cervix" and consists of a tan uterus (9.4 x 6.5 x 5.1 cm, 126 g) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (right: 6.1 x 0.8 x 0.4 cm, left: 7.1 x 0.7 x 0.3 cm) and attached bilateral ovaries (right: 3.5 x 2.6 x 1.5 cm, left: 3.6 x 2.6 x 1.8 cm). The uterine fundus serosal surface is tan-pink and smooth. The ectocervix (3.7 x 2.3 cm) is tan-pink with an eccentrically placed slit-like os (1.5 cm in diameter). The uterus is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal (3.1 cm in length), which is slightly dilated with herringbone architecture. A smooth-walled cyst (0.2 cm) is present within the cervical stroma, filled with gelatinous material. The endometrial cavity (3.9 x 2.7 cm thick) is scantly hemorrhagic. The myometrium, ranging from 0.9-2.0 cm in thickness, is tan-pink and contains no nodules. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan lumens. The bilateral ovaries are sectioned to reveal multiple smooth-walled cysts (ranging from 0.3-0.5 cm). Section code A1: Anterior ectocervix with endocervical canal A2: Posterior ectocervix with endocervical canal A3-A4: Anterior endomyometrium, representative A5-A6: Posterior endomyometrium, representative A7: Right ovary, representative A8: Right fallopian tube, representative A9: Left ovary, representative A10: Left fallopian tube, representative

diagnosis: Cervix with partially denuded and atrophic epithelium.

Leiomyoma, uterus.

specimens.gross_description: Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, "uterus, cervix, bilateral fallopian tubes " and consists of a small tan-pink uterus (6.5 x 3.9 x 2.2 cm, 32 g) with a smooth serosal surface. The remaining ectocervical mucosa (1.3 x 1.1 cm) is focally hemorrhagic and diffusely ragged. The specimen is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal (2.7 cm in length) with herringbone architecture. The endometrial cavity (1.9 x 1.2 x 0.1 cm) is tan-pink and scantly hemorrhagic. The myometrium ranging from 0.9-1.2 cm in thickness is tan-pink and contains a single tan-white whorled nodule (0.9 x 0.7 x 0.7 cm) on the left lateral aspect. Separately in the container are 2 segments of fimbriated fallopian tubes (2.5 x 1.1 x 1.0 cm, 3.5 x 0.9 x 0.9 cm) and 2 separate segments of non fimbriated fallopian tubes (2.6 x 0.5 x 0.4 cm, 3.2 x 0.4 x 0.4 cm) which are sectioned to reveal tan lumens. Ink code Blue-anterior Black-posterior Section code A 1: Cervix 12-3 o'clock A 2: Cervix 3-6 o'clock A 3: Cervix 6-9 o'clock A 4: Cervix 9-12 o'clock A 5: Anterior lower uterine segment, perpendicular A 6: Posterior lower uterine segment, perpendicular A 7: Anterior endomyometrium, representative A 8: Posterior endomyometrium, representative A 9: Tan-white whorled nodule, representative A 10: Longer fimbriated fallopian tube segment, representative A 11: Shorter fimbriated fallopian tube segment, representative A 12: Longer fallopian tube segment without fimbria, representative A 13: Shorter fallopian tube segment without fimbria, representative
